alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Hamilton; McMinn (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 02 at 12:53AM CST until March 02 at 2:45AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EST FOR NORTHERN BRADLEY...SOUTHWESTERN MEIGS...SOUTHWESTERN MCMINN AND EAST CENTRAL HAMILTON COUNTIES... At 152 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 10 miles northwest of Cleveland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Charleston around 210 AM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Birchwood, Calhoun, Hillsview, Big Spring and Hopewell. This includes Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 29 and 38. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! If a tornado or other severe weather is spotted, report it to the National Weather Service or your local nearest law enforcement agency who will send your report. This act may save lives of others in the path of dangerous weather.
